history.content: The new scheduling system doesn't not allow undergraduate students to enroll directly in graduate courses and vice versa. If there are seats in the EE course and no waitlist, I'd be happy to enroll you. You can email me at lraya@berkeley.edu.

children.subject: This is a campus-wide policy (getting the enrollment code from department staff), and should have been in place since last semester.

I take it back! From the SIS team:

There is no career level restrictions on Graduate students enrolling in Undergraduate level classes. However, there may be seat reservations, unit level loads, time conflicts, or other restrictions that may prevent the enrollment from succeeding. If you can create a Service Now ticket with the student's ID and the class number, we can review the errors on the enrollment request.

You can email me your SID number and they can look into this. Please let me know in which class you were trying to enroll as it may be an enrollment restriction other than career that's preventing you from enrolling.

Thanks, Raya.
Is it a campus policy? Or is it just EECS?
Say if i want to enroll an undergrad course in another department, do i have to follow the same protocol (e.g., asking a counselor to manually add me)?

I was able to enroll undergrad course with no problems a month ago. I am really frustrated by the sudden change in the enrollment policy.

history.content:
I am an EECS graduate student.
I tried to sign up for an upper div EE course. But the system says it is out of career. And I am not able to sign up.
Some EE upper div do not have a graduate variant. I would like to know if this is a system error, or a new departmental/campus policy.

Thanks!
history.subject: EECS graduate students cannot sign up for eecs undergraduate courses?
